com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk

Class Hbar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.Hbar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Hbar>

    public final class Hbar
extends Object
implements Comparable<Hbar>
    Typesafe wrapper for values of hbar providing foolproof conversions to other denominations.

    May be positive, negative or zero.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hbar

        public Hbar(long amount)
        Wrap some amount of hbar.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount in hbar, may be negative.
        Throws:
        HbarRangeException - if the tinybar equivalent does not fit in a long.

      • Hbar

        public Hbar(BigDecimal amount)
        Wrap a possibly fractional amount of hbar.

        The equivalent amount in tinybar must be an integer and fit in a long (64-bit signed integer) as that is required by the Hedera network.

        E.g. 1.23456789 is a valid amount of hbar but 0.123456789 is not.

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount in hbar, may be fractional and/or negative.
        Throws:
        HbarRangeException - if the tinybar equivalent is not an integer or does not fit in a long.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static Hbar from(long amount,
                        HbarUnit unit)
        Calculate an hbar amount given a value and a unit to interpret it as.

        The equivalent amount in tinybar must fit in a long (64-bit signed integer) as that is required by the Hedera network.

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount in the given unit, may be negative.
        unit - the unit to multiply the amount by.
        Returns:
        the calculated hbar value.
        Throws:
        HbarRangeException - if the tinybar equivalent does not fit in a long.

      • from

        public static Hbar from(BigDecimal amount,
                        HbarUnit unit)
        Calculate an hbar amount given a value and a unit to interpret it as.

        The equivalent amount in tinybar must be an integer and fit in a long (64-bit signed integer) as that is required by the Hedera network.

        E.g. 1.234 is a valid amount in HbarUnit.Millibar but 1.2345 is not as that is 1234.5 tinybar.

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount in the given unit, may be fractional and/or negative.
        unit - the unit to multiply the amount by.
        Returns:
        the calculated hbar value.
        Throws:
        HbarRangeException - if the tinybar equivalent is not an integer or does not fit in a long.

      • fromTinybar

        public static Hbar fromTinybar(long amount)
        Wrap an amount of tinybar; not to be confused with of(long).
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount, in tinybar; may be negative.
        Returns:
        the wrapped hbar value.

        public String toString()
        Get a human-readable printout of this hbar value for debugging purposes. Not meant to be shown to users (localization/pretty-printing are not implemented). The output format is unspecified.
        Overrides:
